newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-BOWRON WINS WOMEN'S 800 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-BOWRON WINS WOMEN'S 800 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.

text.p: Natasha Bowron claimed Australia's sixth title at the world short-course swimming championships by winning the women's 800 metres freestyle on Friday.
Bowron, 15, set the pace throughout and left Australia top of the medals table at the end of the second day of the four-day championships.
She won in eight minutes 26.45 seconds from Germany's Kerstin Kielgass, who clocked 8:28.10, and Carla Geurts of the Netherlands, the silver medallist in 1995, who finished in 8:28.96.
